column4: I recently installed a clean load of 8.04 x64, what is my root password?
there is not root password nor root account activated by defualt
ubottu is not human, but yes, you can "become" root with sudo. It is very convenient.
I need the jre, can I just change the name of the download?
and you do not need to follow strange steps form the Sun site to install Java. Java is in the repos, you can apt-get it.
I've got the file I downloaded from sun, now I just need to figure out how to install it.
don't do it that way is my advice.  Do "sudo aptitude install sun-java6-jdk"
search packages through synaptic, yes. JRE is the runtime only, I thought you wanted the development kit to actually program in java. Maybe I didn't get you the first time.
ty.  I got it installed but it don't work in Firefox.
well, there is a separate package for the web plugins, I think ..."sun-java6-plugin"
btw, will these work on the x64 version?
ow! Maybe you want to try the 64-bit forum in ubuntuforums.org  I really don't know... Maybe they work, maybe not. If they are in the repos they should work. Arg, don't know.
